abstract: At this weekend’s emergency summit meeting of world leaders in Washington, President Nicolas Sarkozy of France promises to be at center stage. But, The New York Times’s Nelson D. Schwartz and Katrin Benhold write, that isn’t stopping the country’s finance minister, Christine Lagarde, from doing everything she can to tamp down expectations for big changes emanating from the meeting.
lead_paragraph: At this weekend’s emergency summit meeting of world leaders in Washington, President Nicolas Sarkozy of France promises to be at center stage. But, The New York Times’s Nelson D. Schwartz and Katrin Benhold write, that isn’t stopping the country’s finance minister, Christine Lagarde, from doing everything she can to tamp down expectations for big changes emanating from the meeting.

headline.main: France’s Finance Minister in a Critical Role at Global Economic Talks

abstract: In an internal memorandum sent to the firm’s employees Thursday night, Richard D. Parsons, the former Time Warner chief executive and Citigroup‘s lead outside director, argued that there’s no dissension at the top
snippet: In an internal memorandum sent to the firm’s employees Thursday night, Richard D. Parsons, the former Time Warner chief executive and Citigroup‘s lead outside director, argued that there’s no dissension at the top
lead_paragraph: Citigroup is under pressure from a lot of fronts these days. But a well-known member of its board is urging the financial giants’ employees to keep their chins up.

headline.main: Parsons Urges Citi to ‘Keep the Faith’
